title: Project-Based Education to Improve Long-Term Memory Using Concept Maps in CLIL (Content and Language Integrated Learning) Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Scientific Knowledge and Intermediate English Language Proficiency
context.additional_context: Students primarily use digital tools accessible via smartphones, with the goal of learning science concepts in English (L2) through project-based tasks and strengthening long-term memory retention

learning_goals: Learners can explain relationships between core concepts with over 80% accuracy by creating English concept maps on scientific topics
Learners can reproduce over 70% of concept map learning content in assessments 4 weeks later through project deliverables
Learners collaboratively share concept maps and present structured representations of scientific knowledge in L2 environments at least 3 times

resources: Mobile-Optimized Concept Mapping Tools (e.g., Coggle, SimpleMind)
Whiteboard Markers/Posters for Offline Group Activities
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
